title: Unpopular Opinion: I think backdooring is unsportsmanlike
body: Desperate last ditch attempt at ending a game without playing the game. You and your team have decided that you probably won't/can't win a decisive team fight so you take the easy way out and make sure the ~~winning~~ enemy team isn't paying attention so you can sneaky deaky your way into their base and PvE your way to victory. It takes the fun out of the competitive PvP aspect of the game, it removes the skill and thrill of outplaying someone (inb4 "b-b-but you outplayed them by outsm-sm-smarting them!" get away from me), and it feels all around bad to be winning and doing really well and just have someone sneak behind your team and kill a Nexus before the ENTIRELY TOO LONG recall timer sends you back to base to defend. Split pushing is annoying, but I don't really have a problem with it. But I can't stand backdooring. Just ruins games, man.

If you want teamfights with no option of the team ignoring teamfights, play ARAM. It's teamfights all the time and the only way backdooring is possible is with stealth champs.

You're absolutely correct. All of those are valid critiques and I've had grievances with people only picking whatever is currently overtuned for years. But since Riot won't do anything to prevent/fix it (because the playerbase would... dare I say _RIOT_... if there wasn't something really strong and barely counterable hovering just at the top of the meta) you accept it as "just the way things are" and "just part of the game". But it doesn't have to be; it never had to be. It's laziness, but people blame it on "meta shifts".

But it does make sense - all the people in favor of backdooring aren't interested in fun games; they're interested in wins. In a ranked mind set, anything goes and do whatever it takes. I just think that mindset takes what little bit of fun is left in League of Legends™ out.
